meanings.definition: A piece of armor made of small overlapping metal plates or scales sewn to a flexible backing.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore brigandines to protect himself in battle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient brigandines worn by warriors long ago.
meanings.sent3: The brigandines clinked softly as the knight tried to sneak up on his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her brigandines, shielding her from the harsh words of others.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the brigandines, creating a dazzling effect.

meanings.definition: A type of medieval body armor consisting of a doublet with small metal plates sewn between layers of cloth.
meanings.sent1: In the reenactment, the actors wore brigandines to look like authentic knights.
meanings.sent2: The brigandines were carefully crafted to provide both protection and flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squire tripped over the brigandines, causing laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was his brigandines, shielding him from the harshness of the world.
meanings.sent5: The brigandines gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of strength and resilience.
